intro: Kniphofia parviflora var. albiflora, commonly known as the white torch lily, is a striking perennial plant native to South Africa. It features tall, upright stems that bear dense clusters of white to pale yellow flowers, which are tubular and often tinged with red at the base. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that form a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its showy blooms attract pollinators like bees and birds, adding ecological value to the landscape.
